com.github.mikephil.charting.components

Class MarkerView

  • java.lang.Object
    • RelativeLayout
      • com.github.mikephil.charting.components.MarkerView
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IMarker

    public class MarkerView
extends RelativeLayout
implements IMarker
    View that can be displayed when selecting values in the chart. Extend this class to provide custom layouts for your markers.

      • getOffset

        public MPPointF getOffset()
        Specified by:
        getOffset in interface IMarker
        Returns:
        The desired (general) offset you wish the IMarker to have on the x- and y-axis. By returning x: -(width / 2) you will center the IMarker horizontally. By returning y: -(height / 2) you will center the IMarker vertically.

      • setChartView

        public void setChartView(Chart chart)

      • getChartView

        public Chart getChartView()

      • getOffsetForDrawingAtPoint

        public MPPointF getOffsetForDrawingAtPoint(float posX,
                                  float posY)
        Specified by:
        getOffsetForDrawingAtPoint in interface IMarker
        Parameters:
        posX - This is the X position at which the marker wants to be drawn. You can adjust the offset conditionally based on this argument.
        posY - This is the X position at which the marker wants to be drawn. You can adjust the offset conditionally based on this argument.
        Returns:
        The offset for drawing at the specific `point`. This allows conditional adjusting of the Marker position. If you have no adjustments to make, return getOffset().

      • refreshContent

        public void refreshContent(Entry e,
                  Highlight highlight)
        Description copied from interface: IMarker
        This method enables a specified custom IMarker to update it's content every time the IMarker is redrawn.
        Specified by:
        refreshContent in interface IMarker
        Parameters:
        e - The Entry the IMarker belongs to. This can also be any subclass of Entry, like BarEntry or CandleEntry, simply cast it at runtime.
        highlight - The highlight object contains information about the highlighted value such as it's dataset-index, the selected range or stack-index (only stacked bar entries).
